title: Constraining `impl` on `const` arguments doesn't provide enough context

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

labels.name: D-terse
labels.description: A diagnostic that doesn't give enough information about the problem at hand

body:
[Given code using `const` arguments to constraint the applicability of an `impl`](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=781be9f7afd4e1862dc1fe6b60cd2454), we currently give a type error that completely ignores where the bound obligations came from:

```
error[E0308]: mismatched types
  --> src/main.rs:37:24
   |
37 |     println!("{:?}", x + y);
   |                        ^ expected `false`, found `true`
   |
   = note: expected type `false`
              found type `true`
```

This output should be pointing at the obligation chain, closer to [what you get if the failure isn't in a const arg](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=39374a7a28660a1340e0f61a94511504):

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `I32<{ 2..4 }>: IsTrue` is not satisfied
  --> src/main.rs:35:24
   |
35 |     println!("{:?}", x + y);
   |                        ^ the trait `IsTrue` is not implemented for `I32<{ 2..4 }>`
   |
note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `Add<I32<{ 2..4 }>>` for `I32<{ 0..3 }>`
  --> src/main.rs:23:31
   |
23 | impl<T, const R1: Range<i32>> Add<T> for I32<R1>
   |                               ^^^^^^     ^^^^^^^
```
